issue.title: multiline option should be added to syntax_option_type

discussion.p: The specification of ECMAScript defines the Multiline property for its RegExp and the regular expressions ^ and $ behave differently according to the value of this property. Thus, this property should be available also in the ECMAScript compatible engine in std::regex.
This issue interacts somewhat with LWG .
Set the priority to match LWG .
Monday PM: Moved to Tentatively Ready. This also resolves

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4431.

td.ins: Specifies that ^ shall match the beginning of a line and $ shall match the end of a line, if the ECMAScript engine is selected.
